sub_title: Assistant Professor (International Economic Law) at Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies, Leiden Law School
summary:
I am Assistant Professor at the Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies at Leiden Law School, the Netherlands and a Visiting Professor at Vermont Law and Graduate School (VT, USA).

My specializations are International Economic Law, World Trade Organization (WTO) and International Trade Law and the interaction with international and European energy law and regulation.

I am particularly interested in the ongoing crisis in international trade law; security interests and other non-strictly trade-related objectives in international trade law; EU Energy Policy and its interaction with WTO obligations; European energy security, energy and environmental regulation in Preferential Trade Agreements (PTAs); the future of the Energy Charter Treaty; the OPEC cartel; law and economics approaches to energy regulation; the sustainable energy transition; access to supplies and natural resources; public goods; regulation of network industries; squaring energy security with sustainable development and consumer protection; regulation of transit of energy; the Energy Community Treaty and European external energy relations, particularly with the European Neighborhood.

Keywords: 

- International Trade and WTO Law, Economics and Policy
- International and European Energy Law
- Law and Economics
- International Investment Law
- Public International Law
- Natural Resources Law
- Environmental Law and Sustainable Development
- WTO, Energy Charter Treaty
- PTAs and Mega-Regionals
- EU External Relations Law and Energy, Energy Community Treaty

projects.title: Fellow at Platform on International Energy Governance
projects.description: This Platform brings together world leading universities and research centres active in the field of international energy law and policy. It aims to serve as a network of excellence that fosters the conduct of research in unexplored areas of international energy governance.

projects.title: Nomosphone: A Global Law Podcast
projects.description:
Launched in September 2016, Nomosphone is a podcast series led by students in Tilburg Law School’s Global Law Program, coordinated by Dr Phillip Paiement. The podcasts cover current global legal issues ranging from migration to international crime, climate change to global trade. Every few weeks we release a new episode that we think deserves greater public attention.

Supervised the following podcasts:

Episode 007: The Blood in Our Smartphones
https://www.nomosphone.com/blog/2017/7/14/040717-episode-007-the-blood-in-our-smartphones

Episode 009: Catalexit: Will we ever change Euros for Catalan dollars? 
https://www.nomosphone.com/blog/2018/3/07/040717-episode-008-i-rather-wish-the-word-terrorism-had-never-been-introduced-to-the-statue-books-9syw3

Episode 013: Time to Assign Rights to Our Furry Friends
https://www.nomosphone.com/blog/2018/12/6/episode-013-time-to-assign-rights-to-our-furry-friends

company.name: Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies

profile_positions.company: Grotius Centre for International Legal Studies
profile_positions.description:
Tenured • Full-time

My specializations are international economic, WTO and trade law, as well as international and European energy law and regulation.

Teaching: 
- International Trade Law (IDSA Adv LLM) (2021-)
- Challenges in International Trade Law (Duke-Leiden Institute in Global and Transnational Law)(2021-)
- International Economic Law and Sustainable Development (Adv LLM)(2019-2020)
- Practicing International Law: Practicum (LLM)(2019-)
- Public International Law (BA3)(2019-2020)
- Inleiding Internationaal Publiekrecht (BA1)(2019-)

--> Ph.D supervision: Ms. Claudia Pharaon, LL.M; Mr. Joseph Orangias, LL.M; Ms. Bojana Ristic, LL.M
--> Book Review Editor: Leiden Journal of International Law (Cambridge University Press)
--> Member of the Executive Committee of the Society of International Economic Law (SIEL)
--> Member of the Coordination Committee of the European Society of International Law (ESIL) Interest Group on International Economic Law
